Combat Training Camp

The Waterfall Dungeon is a set of connected caverns underneath the Baxtorian Falls. The dungeon can be accessed during and after the completion of the Waterfall Quest, and is an important destination in the quest.

Contents

  • 1 Reaching the dungeon
  • 2 The dungeon
  • 3 Safespots
  • 4 Monsters

Reaching the dungeon[edit | edit source]

Note: Players must use a rope to reach the dungeon's entrance. Players who have not completed Waterfall Quest must also have Glarial's amulet in their inventory (or be wearing it) to gain entry to the dungeon - it is not needed after the quest.

A quick way of getting to Baxtorian Falls is using a Games Necklace and travelling to Barbarian Outpost, then running south.

When you have both of these items, go to the house above the Baxtorian Falls. West of it, behind a gate, there is a raft. Click the raft to ride it and you will crash into a little island.

Do not use the available left-click option to swim to the rock to the south; instead, use your rope on that rock. Once you have safely reached the rock, you are at the top of the Baxtorian Falls. Again, do not fall for the left-click option on the dead tree, but use your rope on that tree to climb down.

You now will be on a small ledge with a barrel and an entrance. If you have completed Waterfall Quest or have Glarial's amulet with you, you may safely enter the dungeon. Otherwise, the barrel allows you to leave the ledge without losing Hitpoints.

If you try to enter without the amulet, or if you forgot to use the rope instead of either of the left-click options, you will fall down the waterfall and wash up to the south, losing 8 Hitpoints. You will then have to run back north onto the top of the waterfall and start over.

The dungeon[edit | edit source]

Within the dungeon, aggressive monsters range from level 16-86, with the higher-levelled fire giants reaching a max hit of 11. The dungeon is popular among Ironmen, due to the much sought after rune scimitar drop from the fire giants. It is also a possible location to be assigned to kill fire giants from Konar as a Slayer task.

The dungeon consists of six different areas:

  1. A cavern with two shadow spiders.
  2. A room with crates with a key, needed for three quests.
  3. A room with seven fire giants.
  4. A room with four fire giants and two shadow spiders.
  5. The path to the Chalice of Eternity.
  6. A room with the Chalice of Eternity.

Safespots[edit | edit source]

The Waterfall Dungeon is often used to kill fire giants. There are two safespots in the dungeon that are commonly used by low-mid levels for training the Ranged and Magic skills (halberds can also be of use here for Melee training although their slower attack speed may be undesirable).

  • A safespot in the western room of the Dungeon, after the fire giants become unaggressive.

  • A safespot in the middle room of the dungeon, after the fire giants become unaggressive.

Cannons may be used in the Waterfall Dungeon. Although it is a single way combat zone.

Monsters[edit | edit source]

There are four different monsters in this dungeon:

  • Shadow spiders, combat level 52, drain Prayer and are invisible on the minimap
  • Skeletons, combat level 45
  • Skeleton Mages, combat level 16
  • Fire giants, combat level 86, max hit of 11

A quick way of getting to [[Baxtorian Falls]] is using a [[Games necklace|Games Necklace]] and travelling to [[Barbarian Outpost]], then running south. When you have both of these items, go to the house above the Baxtorian Falls. West of it, behind a gate, there is a raft. Click the raft to ride it and you will crash into a little island. '''Do not''' use the available left-click option to swim to the rock to the south; instead, '''use your [[rope]] on that rock'''. Once you have safely reached the rock, you are at the top of the Baxtorian Falls. Again, '''do not''' fall for the left-click option on the dead tree, but '''use your rope on that tree''' to climb down. You now will be on a small ledge with a barrel and an entrance. You will then have to run back north onto the top of the waterfall and start over. ==The dungeon== Within the [[Dungeons|dungeon]], [[aggressive]] [[monsters]] range from level 16-86, with the higher-levelled [[fire giant]]s reaching a max hit of 11. It is also a possible location to be assigned to kill fire giants from [[Konar quo Maten|Konar]] as a [[Slayer]] task. The dungeon consists of six different areas: #A cavern with two [[shadow spider]]s. #A room with crates with [[A key (Waterfall Dungeon)|a key]], needed for three [[quests]]. #A room with seven [[fire giant]]s. #A room with four fire giants and two shadow spiders. #The path to the [[Chalice of Eternity]]. #A room with the [[Chalice of Eternity]]. ==Safespots== The Waterfall Dungeon is often used to kill [[fire giant]]s. There are two [[safespot]]s in the dungeon that are commonly used by low-mid levels for training the [[Ranged]] and [[Magic]] skills ([[halberd]]s can also be of use here for [[Melee]] training although their slower [[attack speed]] may be undesirable).
